page.title: 11STRONVAR HOUSE BALQUHIDDER
page.content: Stronvar House was built in 1850 for David Carnegie of Gothenburg in Sweden. It was designed by David Bryce and took 2 years to build. David Carnegie owned all the farm land on both sides of Loch Voil and built Stronvar on the south side of Loch Voil. He also built the church and a new school in Balquhidder. David Carnegie lived in it until his death in 1890, leaving Stronvar and a fortune of Â£500000 to his only son, James. The estate remained in the Carnegie family until 1952 when it was broken up. The house was later sold to the Scottish Youth Hostel Association and for 20 years it was a very popular Youth Hostel. The land was sold off as farms. In 1974 Stronvar was bought by Mr and Mrs Donald Hopper who have run it as a guest house since then. In 1985 it is on the market again.
